reviewText: I'm very surprised by the negative reviews for this movie, oh well, some people just don't know quality when it's standing in front of them.If you're interested in horror/science fiction with an element of realism thrown in, then this is the film for you.From the makers of the Blair Witch Project (which sucked but is still culturally significant) this film takes us to rural farm land where a group of rednecks, united by a horrible past event, go into the woods looking for some revenge on the extraterrestrial jerks who have ruined their lives. They capture one and keep it chained up, bringing it back to their buddy's farm house to exact a little torture on it, but are then one by one picked off in various gruesome fashion.The great thing about this movie is that there aren't any really big names in it, and yet the actors all turn in great performances. The storyline is ultra creepy, especially if you're at all into UFO/conspiracy theories.This, and 28 weeks later, are probably the best horror films I've seen in a decade, and is proof positive that you don't have to have a tremendous budget and popular names to make a decent film.Ignore the negative reviews on this one, there's plent of gore and excellent special effects, if you're still a little undecided, then rent it first, but if you're a real fan of horror, then you'll appreciate this film.
summary: This is what a horror movie is supposed to be

reviewText: This movie is about a group of rednecks obsessed with revenge against the aliens that abducted them and experimented on them fifteen years ago and that killed their friend. They manage to capture one of the aliens and things go downhill from there with the alien, that seam to have the interests ripping people's guts out, yes literary this monster like guts, biting and mind control, gets loose again and again to kill pepole in the group. Pretty standard monster movie.And there it is there is nothing new in this movie what so ever, there is a bestial slimy monster, pepole trapped in the wood an lots and lots of gore. The story is paper thin and the special effects is not so special.This is a B movie flick. It can be all right on a slow night when you want to see an monster movie and some senseless mayhem, but there is nothing else in this movie. The plot, acting all is bad.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Altered sure had an enticing description- after 15 years, a group of young men capture the alien that abducted them all those years ago.  They keep the alien tied up in a small room in one of the friends home, however on a few occasions (very few) the alien manages to escape and cause nothing but major problems for the young men.  The problem is clearly with the storyline.  For at least 80% of the movie, all we see are the men discussing their plans concerning their future including relationships and friendships and, of course, retaliation for the alien killing one of their friends/buddies.  At least they showed genuine emotion over this particular persons death.With all this talking going on between the group of friends, surely the payoff has to be worth the wait, right?  Well actually, it probably is... if you're willing to wait over an hour for the actual excitement concerning the freed alien destroying everything to occur.  This *does* finally happen so if there's one thing I can compliment about Altered it's that the final 15 minutes satisfy that urge to see a mysterious creature cause these young men several problems using his physically enhanced abilities.  A segment involving one of the friends battling the alien in the bathroom that quickly spills out to the living room is probably the most memorable one.  Lots of juicy excitement and blood here.The ending is at least fulfilling.  However I simply can't forgive 80% of mediocre movie writing.  That's where the film falls flat.  A cop coming to the house while the friends cover up the alien as best as possible is a decent moment I suppose, but I seriously dislike all the useless bickering and fighting between the friends as the confusion and realization sets in concerning what exactly to do with the captured alien.  Lots of average writing dominates the story here.And the alien itself?  It's pretty neat looking.  Of course it's obvious to me that it's a man in a costume.  Same size as the other humans?  Yes.  The alien has a cool face at least.  He's certainly threatening and creates a couple memorable deaths but... the wait.  The looooong, dreaded wait, haha.  A serious negative in my book. If the movie had atmosphere and suspense I wouldn't have minded, but the story wasn't strong enough to support such an overlong wait.  It would be best to avoid this one, I believe.
summary: no horror, suspense or excitement- a real bummer

reviewText: In ALTERED, a group of good ol' boys nab an alien being (Misty Rosas), in order to exact revenge for the abduction and death of a friend. Unfortunately, things don't go smoothly, resulting in gory death and destruction! Since this was made by one of those responsible for THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT, I wasn't expecting much. So, imagine my shock when this movie turned out to be really good! The creature is menacing and creepy, the humans are like-able, and the story is interesting and different. An excellent sci-fi / horror film...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Made by one of the directors and creators of The Blair Witch Project, Altered tells the story of five men who were abducted by aliens some 15 years prior to this night. Four of them return. Three of them happen to capture one of these creatures and take it back to their fourth friend's home. While payback is on all of their minds, they soon find out it's going to take some doing to do it. Having also bought this movie in a bargain bin, I was expecting the worst as I always do with bargain bin films. I was pleasently surprised to find out that it wasn't bad at all. In fact, for it to feature a group of relatively unknowns acting in the film, it was a tense and suspenseful film that kept me watching til the end. I'll agree with another reviewer here, ignore all the negative reviews about this film. This film is worth checking out, if not buying. Given, it was made on a low budget but it delivers the good that fans expect. I liken this movie to another that came out in 2002 called Frailty. How you ask? Well, it keeps you wondering trying to figure out where things are going in the movie and then surprised by the outcome. It, indeed does, challenges you to figure things out on your own.I look forward to future works by the creators of The Blair Witch Project. It's a shame that most of their works are in bargain bins when they deserve to put with all the classier big budget films on the shelf. If you see a film of theirs, pick it up-I assure you that you won't be disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After being abducted 15 years earlier, four men set out to catch one of their alien captors. When they finally manage to trap one in the woods and return it to their workshop, they open up a whole new nightmare as more of the razor-clawed creatures begin assaulting them from all sides! Brutal, bloody, and violent, ALTERED comes as a big surprise from BLAIR WITCH PROJECT co-writer Eduardo Sanchez! ALTERED borrows the same basic premise from NIGHT OF THE LIVING DEAD, then cranks up the gore and paranoia as we saw in John Carpenter's THE THING. These are not your friendly neighborhood aliens like in E.T., these suckers hunt in packs and rip everything they see to shreds! If that weren't bad enough, they also have the ability to invade your mind, making it impossible to tell just who your friends are... The fast past and gripping suspense will keep you guessing until the very end! Light on story but heavy on mood, Sanchez' alien terror is sure to leave you ALTERED.-Carl ManesI Like Horror Movies
Title: N/A

reviewText: Geez, with all the remakes of old horror flicks these days, I'm losing faith in horror films altogether.  This movie goes to prove a point that horror movie creativity is headed south.  The plot sucked, the acting was predictable and the pulse was about as dull as the script itself.  I'm a fan of the Blair Witch mainly because it struck a chord of truth despite it's overly abundant attempt to be true, but the brothers who made that film wasted their budget on this junk.  There are no doubt kids in grade school that can conjour up better ideas, create more realistic suspense and drive you insane with terror.  But these days, horror directors fall back on old ideas, stale scripts with added gore and one or two decent actors, in hopes that their ship might sail, bringing in a budget that will carry them over until a newer, fresher idea surfaces.  Give me your budget, throw in the towel and let me scare the s#$t out of you, because if movies like these are all you have to offer up, then the genre of horror has a fate sealed in doom.
summary: This movie makes a 70's geology documentary look good
Title: N/A

reviewText: While I don't share the same overrated flawless 5 star opinions of some of the other reviewers here at amazon.com I do think that Eduardo Sánchez's "Altered" is a very good film with just a couple of snags keeping it from being a great film. First off the young lady playing the leads girlfriend was just not up to par with the rest of the cast. She kept reminding me that I was only watching a movie. Except for a moment or two she was lacking any type of realism within her character,but I can live with that. The only other flaw in this film happends to be the most important part of the film,the ending. This is where all the props that have been given for the plot/storyline by the other reviewers just plain confuses me. I love the fathers front poarch scene & if it ended there it would have been a bit better,but from what I can remember the consequence of there actions was supposed to be far worse than a simple "we'll see". I'm a huge fan of loose endings. The kind that leave you asking yourself "what the hell just happend" or the kind that leave room for a sequel but if there is never a sequel it would be just fine the way they left it. Altered left me yelling at my tv screen "that can't be the end! it's not over yet!" the ending wasn't left loose it was basicly like STAY TUNED! Throughout the entire movie we had been warned over & over again that if they did in the beginning what they ended up doing in the end that all hell would break loose & very quickly I might add. For me the reason this ending was somewhat unacceptable was because the movie could have ended in the first 15 minutes with the very same ending. With all that said I must say that Sanchez's long awaited directorial follow-up to his groundbreaking masterpiece 'The Blair Witch Project' was a very good film & far better than some of the mainstream muck that finds it's way to the big screen. One thing that Mr.Sanchez has fully mastered (with both films) is jaw clenching antisipation & the kind that builds throughout this old fashioned anti CGI monster mash is beautiful,but with all that edge of your seat build up I was expecting a climax of truly kick to the gut proprtions or maybe even something funny like leaving dad a gift on his front poarch. Not! we'll see...
summary: Very Good Alien Flick (with a lazy ending).

reviewText: Most worn out story lines involving beings from the far reaches of space have been done and re-done without any new spark or creativity. However, Altered has done what most films before haven't: offer a fresh and some what new story. This film has only climax's it never lets off the throttle until the credits, and it takes alien abduction and flips it on its head and says "Hey what would happen if the crazy trailer trash hicks that always report being abducted by little green men are the ones that abduct the alien." Truly this flick is a winner and must see for any fan of Sci-Fi Horror or anyone that's an edge of your seat junky.

reviewText: When you've been lying low for fifteen years following an exceedingly traumatic, days-long abduction by evil, slimy reptilian aliens, the last thing you want is for your old buddies to show up in the middle of the night with one of those same creatures.  Of course, his former buddies didn't suffer and experience everything Wyatt (Andy Kaufman) did, which is why they are fool enough to only want revenge.  For years, they've been going back out to those same woods hunting something they never really believed would come back - until it did, and they caught the thing.  Never having given much thought to what they would do if they did catch one of the slimy things, they wrap it up in chains and duct tape and take it to the one guy who knows more about the creatures than anyone else - Wyatt.  And so begins a night of terror and suspense and tragedy.Altered starts up as if it might be a comedy - what with three rednecks hunting for aliens in the deep, dark woods (indeed, the project was originally envisioned as a horror comedy) - but it's all serious business by the time the guys get to Wyatt's house.  This whole alien business is like personal squared for Cody (Paul McCarthy-Boyington) because the aliens killed his brother, and even his own father suspects that he killed his bro and blamed it on aliens.  Duke (Brad William Henke) is pretty focused, too, while Otis (Mike C. Williams) is just sort of along for the ride, happy to leave aliens alone as long as they leave him alone.  Unfortunately, this alien doesn't leave anyone alone, including Wyatt's what-the-heck-is-going-on girlfriend Hope (Catherine Mangan).  It's hard to keep a good alien down, and it's even harder to keep a bad alien down, even when he's wrapped up in chains and duct tape.  Wyatt tries to explain why they can't kill the thing (killing an aliens tends to piss off all of his alien friends), but - well, let's just say the whole situation deteriorates rather quickly.There is a lot to like about Altered.  First off, it's about time we turn the tables on some of these aliens who think they can just abduct humans and do whatever they like to them.  Secondly, the film does generate a significant degree of tension as events play out (as one of the taglines says, "It's time for payback.  But payback goes both ways"), even though I did find the ending somewhat anticlimactic.  You also have some pretty good special effects on display here, mostly old school effects rather than CGI.  The gorier moments are particularly well done.  Mostly, though, I just really liked the concept of turning the abduction scenario on its head; it gives this film a measure of creativity that is too often lacking in films of this genre.  I suspect we have writer-director Eduardo Sanchez (of The Blair Witch Project fame) to thank for this.
summary: Not your typical alien abduction movie
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's late, way up in the wild high hills, and you're resting on a little hillock in a ring of oak. You've got the rifle broken open and slung over your forearm, the dogs drowse by your boots, the moon sails out over the crest of the trees and rides the wild night sky in its milky nimbus.Then the night is shattered---not by sound, but by the silence itself. There is a low, throbbing hum: you can barely hear it, but the dogs whine in terror. The ground vibrates; the fog, creeping low over the tussocky earth, is beginning to glow, a wan, treacly yellow. Then everything gets quiet, and you glance at your watch: it has stopped, both hands stretched to midnight.A twig snaps.You're frantic, your mind races, you gasp in terror: it's an alien abduction! What will they look like, these visitors from beyond the stars? What do they want? Will it hurt?What about the anal probe?Alien abductions have transfixed the human imagination since Ezekiel saw the Wheel, JC got beamed up from the Tomb, and Whitley Streiber---um, shook his 'thang' all night on the dance floor with some little bee-bopping aliens and got an anal probe.It is the rawest, the most naked, encounter with the strange, the alien, the unknown, and those terrifying skirmishes on the verge of the Dark provoke questions: What is their interest in us? Are they malevolent? Do they want to rule Earth? Do they eat people? Will they return? And the perennial, at least for the abductee: Why don't they ever call me the morning after?---it makes me feel so cheap.I'm not worried about their intentions. See, I think I've got the aliens who visit Earth in their little glow-in-the-dark space thingies, with their hoses and their slime-tubes and their spores & little alien grey sectopod gear, all that good stuff: they're graduate students.You heard me: Earth is getting all the alien grad students.And they're using us to do their science projects. Senior theses. Whatever they call it on Aldebaran or Alpha Centauri, we're getting them. And maybe a few alien grad student keggers, too, which explains volumes about all the cattle mutilations ("honest to God, I just tried to *tip* the damned thing...").Framed in that light, "Altered", helmed by "Blair Witch" vet Eduardo Sanchez, makes a lot of sense. 15 years ago, townie buddies Otis (Mike Leonard, Mike from "Blair Witch"), Cody, Wyatt, & Duke went out in the woods on a hunting trip: they disappeared. Aliens may have been involved.And were never heard from again. Two weeks ago, their documentary footage turned up, buried beneath a house, showing a mysterious alien autopsy---and a no-holds barred ANAL PROBE!Sorry, kidding. Couldn't resist. Anyway, aliens *were* involved, scarring them forever, etc. etc.: now, tonight, this very evening, they have caught the grey-skinned boodle-eyed alien bungus camper that did this thing to them---this horrific THING---and they mean to do a little "Sleepers" number on him.So they bring him back to Cody's house, which looks more like a big rambling survivalist compound, and they plan to interrogate & then torture the little grey guy, and no I don't mean panties-on-the-head-butt-pictures a la Gitmo. I mean---breaking out the blowtorch & strapping tape.Problem is, as Cody (Paul Boyinger who, like everybody else, does what he has to do) points out, the Greys---Aliens---Big Bugs---these guys mastered intergalactic travel. So---they either control the time stream (doubtful), or they have faster-than-light engines. Which means---well, they can probably figure out who put the hurt down on their buddy Mr. Monkey.And that, of course, might have some severe *intergalactic* implications.Faster than you can say "E.T. phone home!" the little bug-eyed bastard gets loose in the house, and things go very wrong, very fast."Altered" is great fun: a nasty, unevenly suspenseful, deeply atmospheric little terror from the stars romp, not remotely scary but deeply enjoyable nonetheless. It's even better if you've dunked your head in a vat of Kentucky bourbon beforehand: I'm not positive, but I think at one point the alien gets one of the gang in a Full Nelson. Bottom-line: you don't want to watch "Altered" sober. What's the point?"Altered" gets big points for its nasty old-school organic special effects, along with wagonloads of goop. Lots of goop! Huge sackloads of goop & blood and gore, including someone getting his face ripped off & someone (I think that happened---again, bourbon, which really enhanced "Altered") finding out his guts had basically been dragooned as an intergalactic call center---you've really got to love a horror flick happy to wallow in the grue. "Altered" does, & I love the grim psychotic thing for it.Highly recommended, particularly if you plan to kidnap (bugnap?) your former alien tormentor & torture the nasty thing.JSG

reviewText: okay i thought this movie was going to be okay. i figured a little eerie maybe, who knows. well glad i gave it a shot. altered is a movie of a different kind. same stuff just done different, and i liked that. it's about these five guys who were abducted for a few days when they were kids, and as a result one died, and the others were never the same. well many years later the remaining friends come in contact with one of the aliens and take him hostage, while banging him up a bit. now what do they do. one wants to kill him right off, but the others fear all hell will break loose, because where there is one there are others. but all do want to get some sort of revenge for the death of their friend. well they think they're in charge, but the alien is anything but defenseless okay. this thing looks very wicked and evil. they way it runs, damn they look psychotic. just by the look of it you know he's very bad. well unfortunately while in their secluded area the alien becomes unleashed and there's bloodshed here and there. now they have to get rid of it before the others come and find it and them. some scenes are literally gut wrenching. the kills are some good ones. some of this stuff is unbelievable, for real. makes you think about what's out there and kind of creeps you out to know that you can't see them, but they can see you.
summary: THEY'RE OUT THERE AND THEY'RE COMING TO GET YOU!

reviewText: After Reading some 5 star reviews of ALTERED I started to wonder If I watched the same movie so I had to give my perspective on this movie, I just might make you want to see this movie for all the wrong reasons, well I added this to my Netflix account Que after reading the premise of this movie it sounded like a new interesting concept for a story, the day the movie arrived my younger brother happened to be over and had the fortune or misfortune of seeing this movie with me, well needless to say we laughed our asses off so hard I was crying at the absurdity of some of the scenes in this movie, I have to say this movie lingered with me long after the move ended, I couldn't help laughing for 3 hours after the movie ended, up until I put it in the mail box to send it back to Netflix I cant imagine the writer and director taking this movie as a serious Sci Fi Horror movie, as I see it the new ED WOOD of Horror, so bad its funny, this movie shouldn't have been called ALTERED I have a better idea for a title DUMB ALIEN VS DUMB REDNECKS.Now for the reasons this movie made such a lasting impression on me and my brother, its now a comical topic of discussion and laughter among our family and friends, first: Ironically the DUMB REDNECKS return to the woods where they were abducted 15 years earlier to find a DUMB ALIEN that did bad things to them just waiting there for them to return again, so they can get there revenge, like the DUMB ALIENS built a cabin in the woods and was waiting there for them 15 years later, there must be some thing thous DUMB ALIENS like about those particular woods to be hanging out for all that time, 2nd: the ALIEN they captured they tied and tortured endlessly, the DUMB ALIEN escaped and returned for more torture multiple times, I kept thinking to my self give it up already go get reinforcement and come back for a more fair fight, this is suppose to be an ALIEN race that has the technology to travel across the Universe millions of miles to Earth and doesn't have the sense to know when he is out maned (the DUMB ALIEN reminded me of the Coyote in the Roadrunner Cartoons), Last I'm about to spoil the ending for you now.........................don't read past this point if you want to see one of the funniest endings of a movie Ive ever seen, for your self....................the movie closes with a dead, burnt, charred, smoking, DUMB ALIEN left on a Scientists door step, and then the DUMB REDNECKS bail so fast that the scientist doesn't see who left it (they must have been great at Ding Dong Door Ditch when they were kids), when the Scientist opens the door and see's the charred, still smoking dead DUMB ALIEN, the look on his face is priceless, I was crying at this point laughing so hard, I couldn't help but think the DUMB REDNECKS must have used oven mitts to carry that freshly burning, smoking DUMB ALIEN to the door step ( they dont show the actual delivery but a considerable amount of time had to of lapsed from the time the DUMB ALIEN died in an explosion to the point the DUMB REDNECKS pick him up, put him in the bed of there truck and delivered the DUMB ALIEN to the scientist door step, still burning and smoking on the Scientist door step), I guess DUMB ALIENS burn better that Kingston charcoal.........................Wow DUMB ALIEN VS DUMB REDNECKS is a masterpiece of a TURD among turds, I'm sure now you'll want to see DUMB ALIEN VS DUMB REDNECKS.
summary: "I Laughed So Hard I Was Crying !".

reviewText: This film is Dark, Suspensful, Atmospheric, and has a great looking Alien Creature. It gives you a real claustrophobic feeling once they arrive at the house where they keep the alien hostage. The opening scene in the woods is actually pretty scary and the film keeps your full attention from begining to the end. My only little problem that I had with this  film is the dialog. Most of this movie parallels "Scarface" as far as profanity goes. It's really, really vulgar.  I think  The "F" word is probably used at least 100 times throughout the feature but oh well. The film is still way cool and is sure to delight any Sci-Fi or Horror fan. Especially those interested in UFO's and Aliens.Now buzz off!

reviewText: 4 Stars = ClassicDecided to go through my Netflix streaming last night & watch a film. Of course, I went right to the horror section. There sat, "Altered," a film I thought about watching several times in the past, but passed it up for something else. Well, all I got to say is, I waited way to long to see this film!"Altered" is a mean, lean, sci-fi/horror machine! There is no fat to be found here! Five friends get abducted by aliens 15 years before. One of them dies. One of them lives & hides. Three of them go out in the wilds of Florida to hunt down one of the aliens for fifteen years, & are finally successful. What transpires afterwards is a taunt horror thriller that delivers in spades! The acting is top notch, though I have to admit, the first twenty minutes I thought this was going to be a dumb redneck film? I'm sure glad I continued watching, because there is definite method to their madness, as the script reveals real people, not just another hillbilly stereotype exploitation film!After succeeding in capturing an alien, the three friends start to realize exactly how foolish they've been, that is, all except for one, whose brother was killed by the aliens. He was blamed for his brother's death, even by his own father, & put in prison. His performance may be the finest of all the fine performances here, as he spews hatred for the alien, wanting it to feel all the excruciating pain he went through. A  portrait of pure unadulterated revenge, where nothing or no one is going to stand in his way of satisfying it. Also of note is a girlfriend, who gets caught up in this & takes matters in her own hands, literally. A strong female protagonist performance, a rare thing in low budget sci-fi/horror films. All this makes for a very good character study of a group of friends splintered emotionally, & how their forced to deal with the tragedy of the past, & impending the doom of the future."Altered" is no big budget film, but the special effects are fine & the aliens look good. I've seen better make up in higher budget films, but still, the aliens were malevolently convincing.If you want a white knuckled sci-fi/horror thriller, "Altered" is as better than most films of its ilk in the last ten years. A superior effort, especially when you consider it was released straight to DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is essentially about a bunch of hicks who kidnap an alien. The longer the movie goes, the more we find out about the characters, and what starts as an assortment of 1 dimensional characters begins to flesh out a bit. Don't get me wrong, this isn't a character study by any means. It really is a bunch of hicks who kidnap one of the aliens that kidnapped them so many years ago, but it has a refreshing sense of humour, and it's smarter than I expected it would be. They take their time letting us know the back story, and they keep the tension ratcheted up.The special effects are pretty minimal, but sometimes very unsettling. I really appreciate it when a movie with a small budget goes for fewer effects and maintains quality. Real makeup and animatronics are so much more convincing than CGI.If you do enjoy this, you should also check out Splinter.

reviewText: ALTERED is the latest horror flick from director Eduardo Sanchez who also co-wrote the film with Jaime Nash. You may remember Sanchez as half the team who brought you the highly successful BLAIR WITCH PROJECT.  Unlike its predecessor, ALTERED doesn't really break any new ground but it does hit the ground running.The film opens promisingly with three very nervous good ol' boys stalking through the Florida backwoods; Otis, Cody, and Duke. We quickly learn that they are huntin' aliens and have been for the past 15 years, ever since they and 2 of their friends were abducted, experimented upon, and one of them died never to be seen again. As I said a very promising beginning, and the film holds together extremely well for the first third or so until the buddies who have now gathered at the isolated fortress home of Wyatt (the other survivor) start bickering over what to do with their captured alien. Its at this point that things start to fall apart and the film becomes tedious and cliched.  Plot holes abound, illogic runs amuck, and a couple of times we have to ask ourselves WTF?Still there is enough good here to put this at a 3  star rating. The monster is rather impressively designed and executed with the most  impressive set of chompers I've seem in a long time. Some of the actors are quite good too I especially liked Mike C. Williams as Otis (Williams also appeared in BLAIR WITCH as one of the 3 film students) and Brad William Henke as Duke is a loveable ol' redneck if there ever was one. For those who are into that sort of thing, there's also one really good gore scene that should make almost anyone wince. And The package left on a man's doorstep is worth a giggle too.
summary: I Told You To Watch Out For the Bear Traps
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was a very enjoyable film about a group of country boys hell bent on revenge for their past abduction.  They actually manage to capture an alien and it is definitely pay back time.  The story was quite gruesome and definitely not for the squeamish. If flying entrails don't bother you too much you will probably like this film. There is nothing endearing about these aliens who were at least as tough as those featured in the first X-Files movie.Though only competant work, the graphic special effects were convincing enough to bother me.  I would have rated the film at five stars for the new abduction scenario if hadn't been so violent and more than a little warped. However, it held my interest to the end and provided a real twist on the stale alien abduction theme.  This movie could have been an X-Files film, just without our two favorite FBI agents.The story might have been inspired by the reported Travis Walton abduction story about an actual group of mountain boys who in 1975 reported a UFO. One member of their party was missing for days and came back to tell another tale of alien abduction.  The film "Fire in the Sky" was made about this reported event.FIRE IN THE SKY is the comprehensive story of a logger named Travis Walton who mysteriously disappears in 1975 only to turn up bloodied and bruised five days later. Walton and co-workers accidentally discover a UFO and unfortunately they all escape except Walton who is elevated aboard the bizarre aircraft. Onboard he undergoes painful unearthly medical tests.

reviewText: This movie brings to the screen what a lot of 'thrillers' have lacked as of late. Tension, suspense, fear, dread... it's all here.Granted the female actor could have been more in the movie than not, but aside from that it's a great movie.It brings you in right away and keeps you with the characters. You get to know them and the story that brings them together. Good versus evil.... us versus them. It plays the plot out thoughtfully with the balance shifting many times throughout the film.The struggles follow logically as control shifts back and forth. The battle escalates til the end. Not giving the ending away here, but it's left open for a follow up. Which I do believe I would like to see.This is the old fashioned alien... evil... powerful.Definitely a dark night/popcorn kind of movie with a few jump out scenes.You won't be sorry you watched this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Warning: Major Spoilers in this reviewAltered has an exciting beginning with three men pursuing an unknown creature through the woods at night. They finally trap their prey and take it to a fourth friend's house. The setup is ripe for an excellent movie, but the script begins to lose steam at about the 50 minute mark. While I found the acting good overall, given that the actors are not well known, and the alien looks terrific, the plot begins to become annoyingly repetitive at about the halfway point of the movie as we are forced to endure a lot of expository exchanges. The four buddies, and the girlfriend, bicker annoyingly over what should be done with the captive e.t. and the plot stops moving forward. By the time the sheriff makes an unwelcome visit, the movie almost grinds to a halt. The good news is that, shortly thereafter, the action does pick up with one of the most disturbingly graphic scenes I've witnessed in a while. The alien escapes and yanks out a handful of one of the men's intestines and slowly pulls them from his body. Well done indeed, it had me squirming in my seat. As the unlucky victim, Mike Williams (from Blair Witch Project) does a great job in this scene. My only complaint is that, as most of the movie is shot at night, in the woods, a van and in a house that has lost power, many of the scenes are a bit dark. While this does increase tension, at times it is simply annoying since it's often difficult to figure out what is going on. Also, the end feels rather abrupt, leaving some major questions unanswered. Like, what is going to happen with the sheriff's body in the back of the van and will Cody's father do anything with the charred alien corpse on his front step? Did no one notice the major explosion when Wyatt blew his house to hell? Not to mention that the alien invasion that our hero predicted seems to have been aborted or postponed. These quibbles aside, the effects are well done and I enjoyed the movie for what it was, a lower budget scare fest without pretensions that could have benefited from tighter scripting. 3.5 stars
Title: N/A

reviewText: Altered is gripping, and sets you down right in the middle of a situation that is pretty serious: some rednecks go a alien huntin' in the woods - but their catch may be a lot more than they can handle.  Above average acting, lots of creeps, lots of gore, and it is double scary watched at night alone - if you can handle it.The story is pleasantly reminiscent of the X-Files, since the story centers around a past alien abduction.  What is unique is the victims seeking revenge.  All the backstory unfolds as the film progresses, there are a couple of surprising and very good twists.  I really recommend this film.  And I must make mention that the music is perfect for the film.  Unique hollow sounds, of wind, of metal on metal, really suit the mood and create an atmosphere of otherworldliness.

reviewText: I didn't like this film and I regret that I bought and watched it.I was initially interested in "Altered" because the idea seemed original - a group of former abductees who go after their alien kindnappers. But other than this general idea there is hardly anything interesting or original in this film. After the first couple of minutes it becomes just another "straight to DVD" little horror movie. It is so un-original that even the aliens were in large part "borrowed" from "Xtro" trilogy.The scenario is very weak and the story doesn't make much sense. There is also a lot of slime and gore and the language is unbelievably obscene.The only reasons why I give it two stars are the characters of Duke and Otis, two rather likeable although clueless hillbillies, and the design of alien spaceship. All the rest of the film is perfectly forgettable.I am not going to keep my DVD and I certainly do not want to watch this thing never again.
summary: Just another little, rather disappointing horror movie, repeating things we have already seen a hundred times
Title: N/A

reviewText: When trying to describe Altered to my friend, I said "It's like someone took Alien, Signs, I Know What You Did Last Summer, and a bad Jeff Foxworthy comedy sketch and put them all into a blender". That gives a fairly accurate picture of the movie.Plot: It follows the fate of four friends who are haunted by a night years ago when one of their friends died, killed by a mysterious creature. At the time, they were little more than boys, but now that they're men, they're out to exact their pound of flesh from the monster. Yet, things are more complicated than they appear initially, and soon it is evident some creatures are better left undisturbed.Positives: The monster itself is artfully designed to be rather horrific. A cross being HR Geiger's alien and a classic X-Files alien, it is interesting to look at. Adam Kaufman shows he's all grown up after his Buffy the Vampire Slayer appearances in season 4. His portrayal of the tortured and torn Wyatt is the biggest plus to the entire movie. Also, the ending was well done and entertaining. The special effects for the horrible fates of some of the cast are well executed, they made me a little nauseous (I shouldn't be happy about that, but I am)Negatives: Some of the plot is trite- going in you know a lot of the cast won't make it to see the end, and about a half hour in, you have a good idea how it will end.Still, with those few negatives and many positives, I recommend this dark sci-fi horror movie. It is fun and fast paced- a gory, chilling way to spend an evening.

reviewText: Altered is a sci-fi revenge film done by the same team that made The Blair Witch Project.  Like Blair Witch this film is not for everyone.  Some will like the film while others will hate the film.  I am one of those people who liked this film for the most part.  The movie has a very depressing atmosphere, but I think it fit the story.  I liked most of the characters and felt their plight, though there are two that I did not care for.  The effects I think are very well done for the low budget that this had.Fifteen years ago a group of men were abducted by aliens and altered.  One of them died from the alterations.  Now the aliens are back again and these men are out for revenge.  The film starts out with them capturing an alien and bringing it back to the lead guy named Wyatt.  They cannot kill it because more come then.  The alien escapes and it is then a fight to stay alive.Like the Blair Witch Project, this film gets a lot of hate.  Many people do not even know about this film.  I think this film is pretty decent though nothing great.  I like most of the characters and definitely had sympathy for them.  Even if you do not like the characters in the movie you can at least sympathize with them.  Even the characters I did not like I felt sympathy for.  I especially like the main character, Wyatt, because he is the most calm and collected in such a dire situation and is a good leader.  I also like the characters Duke and Otis.  They were also level-headed most of the time and can also be funny.  I also liked the sheriff character that appeared near the middle of the film.  He was not there long, but was in the film long enough for me to like him.I did not like the girlfriend of Wyatt.  In the beginning I thought she was really annoying.  I get what she is going through, but I still thought she was annoying at first.  She gets better by the end but I still do not really care for her character.  I do not like the character Cody either.  Again I sympathize for what he is going through.  His brother was killed by the aliens, he was imprisoned for a long time before the start of the film, and by the end of the film he dies in a horrific way.  However, I still found him to be an annoying prick throughout the first half of the movie and he did a lot of stupid things.  The other at least could still be level headed during the situation.I thought the effects for this film were great.  The budget for this film was only eight million, but they used it effectively.  There is no CGI.  The effects are all practical.  The alien looks great.  It looks kind of like the alien from Signs but even better looking.  Also in the film there is a character that is bitten by the alien and his body gradually deteriorates throughout the movie.  When you see him with his body deteriorated and fragile, it looks great.  That effect looked amazing.Another issue I have is the ending.  It seemed a little out-of-place when compared with the rest of the film.  It is kind of left up in the air, but I felt that the film ended too happily, but maybe that is just me.  I am not usually a fan of downer endings, but the tone of this film makes a happy ending seem out-of-place.Overall, Altered is a fun alien film, horror film, and action film.  It has decent characters (for the most part), great effects, and some good action in parts.  If you are a fan of any of those genres of films then check this out.  It is not a masterpiece but it is not supposed to be.

reviewText: The general public (sadly) enjoys only horror movies that deliver tons of action and a incredibly easy story to follow. Luckily for some of us, once in awhile there is a director that dares to challenge us and make us figure out things for ourselves. Altered is such a movie. Aside from the little paragraph on the back of the DVD, we are forced to put together the pieces of why these men are trying to catch this creature and why they need to keep it alive. Blair Witch fans will be expecting this to be a similar movie, but its quite the opposite. Without giving away too many spoilers, we get to see the creature this time around... a lot. Definitley watch this one at night time alone in a dark room for full effect. Haxan delivers once again!
summary: Ignore Negative Reviews, Movie is Great!

reviewText: ...because if you're hoping for an improvement of that movie, "Altered" indeed will be a disappointment. All I was Hoping for was thriller of the same atmosphere that was "Blair Wich", but seriously now; Is "Altered" supposed to be a comedy or what? Whatever you'd call it I found it purely as a waste of time and expectation! Everything looks fake (even the trees in the forest), and I am actually seldom picky about special effects as long as the story functions. This was as far from "Blair Wich" as it could get. And I find it hard to believe it has the same director! Watch "Signs" once again instead, even "E.T"!One star because of an unoriginal, predictable (there's no twist at the end here!) and self-ruining script that's become "ALtered"... Certain scenes even made this turkey a parody of itself. It's actually a bit sad. Look what the filmmakers managed to do without the money.

reviewText: Well, what a suprise. The co-creator of 'The Blair Witch Project', Eduardo Sanchez really does know how to make a riveting and interesting film without the cheap documentary style of "Blair Witch' that felt like something any college film student could do. I was genuinly suprised. This film while not any sort of ground breaking project falls somewhere between sci-fi silliness and sci-fi classic. I'm leaning more toward the classic direction. It's a film that delivers plenty of great moments. The acting is really very good, the production values are very good, the makeup effects are very good, and the story is more than interesting enough to really keep your attention. While the film feels familiar on numerous levels, it's still one of those movies that for some people will feel like it's a cut above the rest, If you categorize it in the general direct to video sc-fi/horror category. It's got the makings of the sort of film that nearly reaches cult status, but in some ways falls short. It's an odd film that never seems to directly rip-off any particular film, but seems to feel a little more special than the usual cheeseball stuff you see on the sci-fi channel. Over all I was pretty impressed, and it does indeed make "Signs" seem rather bland in comparrison as one member mentioned. I think it's well worth the watch.

reviewText: Perhaps violating a review taboo here, but there is a technology gap evident in reviewers' appreciation of this film. Little or no CG effects here; that necessitates more resourceful editing, acting, and attention to detail. (Computer graphics plugged into current films pay off big time with folks who spend a lot of time with games, perhaps less so with more experienced viewers.) ALTERED is a fine little horror gem that delivers what it promises--and maybe a little more.

reviewText: Altered (Eduardo Sanchez, 2006)The folks who made the surprise 1999 smash The Blair Witch Project haven't done much since. Codirector Eduardo Sanchez waited seven years to make his second feature. Now that I've seen it, I kind of get why. Sanchez, kicking off a new partnership with writer Jamie Nash (with whom he's worked on every project since as of this writing), turns in a brew of unscary aliens, incomplete information, and cliché that will leave you wondering what happened to the stick figures.Plot: a bunch of high school kids on a camping trip in the woods one night had something happen to them. Now it's fifteen years later, and the rest of the survivors from that night show up on the doorstep of Wyatt (Without a Trace's Adam Kaufman), who's distanced himself from the gang and now lives a happily secluded life. On this particular night, he's hanging out with a cutie named Hope (Monster's Catherine Mangan). Well, you get the idea from the beginning of the movie that the two of them are in a long-term relationship, and maybe living together, but something he says about halfway through the film leads us to believe that this is just a one-night stand. (This is far from the only inconsistency in the movie, but it's the most amusing one.) In any case, he's hanging out at home with said cutie when the other guys, Cody (The Outisde's Paul McCarthy-Boyington), Duke (The Thirteenth Floor's Brad William Henke), and Otis (The Blair Witch Project's Michael C. Williams) show up carrying a bundle with a welder's helmet over its head. Turns out this is an alien, and the "what happened" from that camping trip is that Wyatt and Cody's brother were abducted, and the other three have spent years, in Duke's words (my memory's a bit hazy on this point, but I think Duke mentions they've spent the past seven years on this project), looking for the same batch of aliens so they could kidnap one and get revenge. Now they've got one... but they can't kill it, because it will call its pals to come destroy the human race. Etc.In general, if you've seen one alien abduction movie, you've seen 'em all, and hasn't everyone in America seen Close Encounters of the Third Kind at this point? Not to say it's a bad movie; the acting is solid, even if the plot isn't. Sanchez, though, didn't even attempt to add anything new to the alien-abduction canon. For that matter, aside from the alien and a smattering of special effects throughout the movie (you'll love the transmitters!), this could easily be a typical locked-room survival horror flick rather than sci-fi. Still, as I said, this doesn't make it a bad movie, just a derivative one. If there's nothing else on, it's worth a gander, but one wonders what happened to the spark that gave us The Blair Witch Project. **

reviewText: A group of rednecks go alien hunting.  Otis, Cody, and Duke manage to bag one of the beasties and take it to Wyatt's house.  Why?  Evidently, all four were victims of the aliens in the past, including Cody's brother Timmy who was killed during the early encounter.  Otherwise, its never explained why they bagged this bad boy or why they brought it alive over to Wyatt's.Wyatt's girlfriend Hope is not amused.  She calls the sheriff.  Wyatt has some sort of relationship with these aliens, having been imbedded with a "clicker" in his intestines years ago.  Evidently, the aliens want more clickers installed because they have a predilection for intestine pulling.  The intestine pulling is what raised this from one to two stars.  Do the boys kill the alien or return it?  Are there ramifications to killing this alien?  Wyatt seems to think so, but it turns out Wyatt has been ready for their return for years.The most interesting part of this movie is that when they finally show the aliens, their mouths look vaguely like a discreet southern body part of the female anatomy, but with big teeth.  Freud would have a field day.The FX is bad (I swear I saw a zipper), the acting isn't bad but nothing to run to the awards with either, and the dialogue is juvenile.  (One minute Hope stomps away from Wyatt's truck, the next moment she swears she'll never leave him)  This movie was bad, not even cheesy bad but bad.  Do yourself a favor and rent before you buy.

reviewText: Picked this dvd up on a whim.  I personally hadn't heard anything about it, but I saw it was directed by one of the guys who co-wrote and co-directed (whatever that means) The Blair Witch Project.  That's not great, but it was something to go on.  In the very least it promised that the storyline might be innovative.I thought Altered was really good! It's a pretty simple plot: three hicks, who have been hunting aliens for seven years, finally catch one and take it to their friend's house. The friend, Wyatt, has had contact with the aliens before, having been abducted nearly fifteen years ago.  Most of the hijinks involves these four guys Wyatt's girlfriend and the abducted alien. The story is sort of derivative, combining elements from Night of the Living Dead, the original Alien and maybe a dash of Signs. But this managed to take those pieces and still make a highly suspenseful film!The characters were fleshed out just enough where you cared what happened to them. Honestly Adam Kaufman's Wyatt stole the show. The man has charisma. As for the rest, in this day and age where every horror character is a sassy b*tch, it was nice to see dialog that was restrained and functional. They still managed to sneak a few jokes in, but they were so subtle and/or situational that it worked pretty well. The only one who comes across as an amateur is the girlfriend. I've seen oak trees that were less wooden than her delivery. Still, considering this was a nobody, no publicity, nothing, straight to video indie flick I'm surprised at how good she was in comparison to other similar projects.The special effects were pretty good. Everything was hand made special effects, so you don't have any of that fakey CGI smeared around.  Movies ten times the budget haven't learned that lesson yet. The character design for the alien was pretty good. It sported an animatronic face and probably a small, athletic bloke in a rubber suit with the result being some of the best monster realism since Aliens.  The best part was the disembowel scene; realistic without being disgusting, a chuckling that's-gotta-hurt moment if I ever saw one.  Really, this was a pleasant surprise, given where the sequel to the Blair Witch went. Maybe Eduardo Sanchez has a future in horror after all!
summary: Maybe Eduardo Sanchez has a future in horror!

reviewText: If Seinfeld is the show about nothing, Altered is the movie about nothing. These four friends were abducted by aliens fifteen years earlier, so these geniuses decide to get revenge by kidnapping one of the aliens. They accomplish their goal, but once they do, they don't know what to do with it and lock it in the garage. After that it becomes a slasher film where nothing significant really happens. Honestly, they kidnapped this thing and then don't know what to do with it, so then what's the point? To make things worse, we never see the abduction or find out what exactly happened to them up there. It's just an extremely dark and confusing hunting scene, which believe it or not features a harpoon, and then there is nothing else. As for the acting it is just as inconsistent as the story! One minute their going crazy, trying to kill each other and the next they're crying about old times, it's ridiculous! James Gammon is the only name in this thing, playing the sheriff in one of his last roles. The guys are so intimidated by the sheriff and when we finally see him, we find out he's this little eighty year old guy, are you kidding me? This movie is a complete disaster and an utter waste of time. Being that it's from the writer/director of The Blair Witch Project, I was expecting something as groundbreaking as that was, unfortunately, Altered isn't it and there is a good reason why you've probably never heard of it.

reviewText: The whole idea of alien abductees trying to get even by capturing their alien abductors is quite a novel plot.  Whats missing is a few flashbacks of the alien process,(would of reqired a bigger budget) that would emphasis why these guys hated their captors so much.  Instead they express their frustration through profanity and raging dialogue, causing the viewer to have little sympathy for them.  The make-up artists do pretty well with the alien creature's appearance, though I think at least in part it's look is owed to something from the "X-Files". Theres some good plot twists and plenty of creative gore.  Worth the rental for a weekend frightfest!
summary: Not bad, but would have been better with a bigger budget...
